faq.title: FAQ
faq.subtitle: Questions and answers about using the conversion tool

q1.question: What is json to base64 and base64 to json conversion?
q1.answer: json to base64 is encoding JSON data to Base64 format, while base64 to json is decoding Base64 data back to JSON format, commonly used for transmitting structured data in text protocols.

q2.question: Why use conversion tools?
q2.answer: Conversion tools can avoid special characters in JSON being escaped during transmission, and can simply obfuscate sensitive data for security purposes.

q3.question: What's the maximum JSON file size supported for conversion?
q3.answer: Theoretically no size limit for processing, but for optimal user experience, we recommend single JSON files not exceed 10MB.

q4.question: How to validate JSON format before conversion?
q4.answer: The tool automatically validates JSON syntax before processing and displays detailed error messages if format is incorrect.

q5.question: How is data security guaranteed during operations?
q5.answer: All conversion operations are completed locally in the browser, data is not uploaded to servers, completely protecting your privacy.
